locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explores the biblical motif of 'singing' as a revolutionary act against a numbing culture. He traces this through Miriam, Hannah, Mary, the Exiles, and Paul/Silas, concluding with an address to the ordinand about the role of a teacher.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Brueggemann uses socio-political exegesis to link ancient texts to contemporary 'numbness'.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of the 'old story' and its effects, transitioning into a commission for the ordinand.
voorbeelden: I propose that your ordination today is primarily so that the church does not lose itself.
We commend you to God in thanksgiving.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To mobilize the ordinand and the congregation to move from 'numbness' to 'wonder, love, and praise'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate; mentions the 'dangerous song put on our lips by the spirit'.

voorbeelden: Angry people do not sing much.
The Lord is one who will make a difference.
The narrative does not explicitly connect the singing and the earthquake.
Consider the way we have been singing.
Imagine that the singing you make possible will evoke more than one emancipatory earthquake!
I believe, is how our dominant society wants it to be.
I propose that your ordination today is primarily...
We will continue to pray for your well-being.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are communal/ecclesial rather than direct divine 'I promise you' locutions.

voorbeelden: The church designates you today as a teacher.
This ordination that we enact today is a bet.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Strong institutional/sacramental authority regarding the act of ordination.

indicatoren: Extensive lists of 'kinds of people who do not sing'.
Long historical recountings of Miriam, Hannah, and Mary.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is educated on the history of singing but remains an observer until the final section.

missende_elementen: Direct divine promise (God says to you...)
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The sermon feels like a brilliant lecture until the 'pivot point' of the ordination act.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Focused on the efficacy of the 'old story' rather than a direct address of grace.
voorbeelden: It is never too late in the mercy of God.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's observations and the 'We' of the ordaining body.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Directly addressing the ordinand (Robert) and the 'you' of the church.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used during the charge and commendation.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the 'angry people', 'Pharaoh', and biblical characters.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that is only bridged in the final section.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Biblical history and the 'old, old story'.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Sociological observations about society and 'angry people'.

actueel_present.gebruik: The actual act of ordination happening 'today'.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the Assertive (The story of singing) to the Declarative (Ordination act) to the Commissive (Commending to God).
voorbeelden: The church designates you... We commend you to God.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Strongly sacramental because it is an ordination sermon; the speech act *is* the event.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because they knew the old, old story... they were able to keep singing.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: While heavily constative in the first 80%, the sermon is saved by the specific illocutionary force of the ordination rite which 'enacts' a new reality for the candidate.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Robert, the church designates you today...
sterke_punten.effect: Transforms the lecture into a life-changing event.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I have been making a list of the kinds of people...
zwakke_punten.probleem: The opening is a sociological lecture 'about' people rather than an address 'to' them.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The ordination context provides the necessary 'felicity conditions' for the words to perform an action.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher explicitly states 'This ordination that we enact today', claiming the speech act as a reality-changing event.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicit; God is the 'forceful agent' behind the song.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, explicitly acting on behalf of the 'church'.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the source of the 'dangerous song'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the 'evoking' of earthquakes is left to the power of the song/Spirit.
tekstueel_bewijs: dangerous song is put on our lips by the spirit

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the 'telling' is what makes the 'singing' possible.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: High, especially in the description of the 'old, old story'.
tekstueel_bewijs: We situate you at this pivot point between story and song.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon relies heavily on 'is/was' (Assertive). It needs more 'I/We [Verb] you' (Declarative) to sustain the event-character throughout.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Lord is one who will make a difference.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The Lord makes a difference for you here and now.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a present-tense address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The 'old story' is described as a third-person object.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Frame the 'old story' as a direct promise to the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: This mercy is promised to you today.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The first half is 'about' people (3rd person).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the 'angry/tired' people in the pews directly.
voorbeeldzinnen: You who are tired, the song is for you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain the current flow as it is well-grounded.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in how the 'locutionary' content of biblical theology can be funneled into a 'performative' sacramental act of ordination.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT's focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation', SAT reveals the sermon as an objective 'enactment' of the church's mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the 'list' of people (rhetoric) but in the 'designation' of the teacher (illocution).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT highlights that the sermon's climax is not the information about Mary or Miriam, but the 'Commending' and 'Designating' at the end.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Robert, the church designates you today as a teacher.

appendices.notities: The sermon functions as a 'Speech Act' primarily because of its liturgical context (Ordination).
